channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Colorado clerk sentenced to 9 years for voting system breach tied to election conspiracy
item.description: Tina Peters, ex-Mesa County clerk, received a nine-year prison sentence for her role in breaching the county's voting system and promoting 2020 election conspiracy theories. Judge Matthew Barrett emphasized her defiance, denying probation. Peters had been convicted on multiple charges, including attempting to influence a public servant and unauthorized system access using another's security badge.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris' husband denies slapping ex-girlfriend: 'Any suggestion....untrue'
item.description: After a studied silence for a day, the spokesperson of Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff confirmed to Semafor that the report of Kamala Harris' husband slapping his girlfriend in 2012 is untrue. In a statement to Semafor, a spokesperson for Emhoff said “this report is untrue,” and that “any suggestion that he would or has ever hit a woman is false.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Connecticut man charged after allegedly assaulting pregnant woman during carjacking
item.description: A 28-year-old man in East Haven, Connecticut, was apprehended after assaulting a pregnant woman during a Dunkin' Donuts carjacking. Employees intervened, restraining him until police arrived. The attacker, identified as William Rodriguez, faces multiple charges, including assault and larceny, and is held on significant bond along with outstanding arrest warrants.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Melania Trump ask $250,000 for an interview with CNN? Here's what we know
item.description: "Neither Melania nor anyone from her team knew anything about the NDA and the document that was sent reflected an internal miscommunication," Tony Lyons, the president and publisher of Skyhorse, told CNN in a statement. “Had CNN signed an NDA, in the normal course of business, we would have approached Melania’s team to discuss [specifics of the interview],” Lyons said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Former GOP representative Liz Cheney to campaign for Harris at birthplace of Republican party
item.description: US Vice president Kamala Harris targets dissatisfied Republicans by visiting the birthplace of the GOP in Ripon, Wisconsin, accompanied by former Representative Liz Cheney, a vocal Trump critic. Cheney's endorsement, alongside her father's, and support from other prominent Republicans highlight the campaign's efforts to sway key voters ahead of the 2024 election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: King Charles misses 'darling boy' Harry but it is William who...
item.description: "With Prince Harry, it’s all an issue of trust," said Fordwich. "Prince William is the most unlikely royal to ever forgive Harry for all his despicable indiscretions. He is now very much seen and accepted as the family enforcer, taking on the hard-line ruler role of his grandfather, Prince Philip. In this capacity, it’s widely known within the family that Prince William has laid down an absolute ban on Harry returning in any way, shape or form to his former royal family fold," Fordwich said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I think that would be a little ...': Biden 'discussing' possible Israeli strikes on Iran oil facilities
item.description: US President Joe Biden is discussing potential Israeli strikes on Iranian oil facilities, leading to a five per cent surge in oil prices. He stressed that the US advises rather than directs Israel's actions. The discussions come amid rising tensions following Iran's missile attack on Israel and the impending US presidential election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Helene leaves 200 dead as Georgia and North Carolina report more fatalities
item.description: Hurricane Helene has resulted in 200 fatalities, severely impacting Georgia and North Carolina with rescue operations ongoing. The death toll rose from 189 to 200, with Georgia adding eight deaths and North Carolina adding three to their totals.Federal support is pledged for recovery, with President Biden and Vice President Harris visiting affected areas. The storm made devastating landfall in Florida and is the deadliest since Hurricane Katrina.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'That's panic...': Expert decodes Tim Walz’s body language during debate
item.description: During the vice presidential debate, Minnesota governor Tim Walz faced scrutiny over his claim about being present during the Tiananmen Square protests. A body language expert noted his signs of panic and diversion tactics when confronted about his actual travel dates to Asia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump campaign reacts to Sunny Hostin's 'Melania hates Donald' claim: 'DISGUSTING'
item.description: Trump's campaign condemned Sunny Hostin's viral claim on The View that Melania Trump hates her husband and wishes to distance herself from him. This comes amid Melania's memoir's endorsement of women's reproductive rights, contrasting her husband and the Republican Party's anti-abortion stance. Sunny Hostin, however, is not alone in what she thinks about Melania; Anthony Scaramucci earlier said the same thing about Melania's relationship with Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'She's been my biggest supporter since day one': Elon Musk praises his mother Maye Musk
item.description: Elon Musk's mother, Maye Musk, expressed gratitude on social media after Elon described her as his greatest supporter. Highlighting his visionary ideas, she cited Starlink's critical role in providing internet during disasters like Hurricane Helene, emphasizing his foresight and care for the future.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least 50 killed as boat capsizes in eastern Congo lake
item.description: A boat overloaded with passengers capsized on Lake Kivu, eastern Congo, killing at least 50 people. The vessel was en route from Minova to Goma. Overcrowding and negligence are blamed as the boat had a capacity for about 30 passengers but carried around 100. Rescue efforts continue, with ten survivors receiving medical care.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: On Elon Musk's 'how many people' question over Diddy, singer says, 'Ask your friends...'
item.description: When Elon Musk asked the question about Hollywood's involvement with Diddy as every day a new name pops up in connection with Diddy's infamous parties, he probably did not expect to get a straight up reply from Aubrey O'Day. " “..ask your friends, they will tell you," Aubrey posted implying that Elon Musk's "friends" knew about Diddy and his shady dealings.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Tim Walz lie about his 17 year old son witnessing a shooting?
item.description: During a debate, Democrat Tim Walz claimed his son witnessed a community centre shooting, which Republican JD Vance sympathetically addressed. However, journalist Kyle Becker disputed Walz's claim, stating police records show the incident occurred outside, calling Walz's statement into question.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US couple married for over 50 years die hugging each other during Hurricane Helene
item.description: A South Carolina couple, Marcia and Jerry Savage, both in their 70s, died when a tree fell on their home during Hurricane Helene. Their grandson had just checked on them before the incident. The storm has claimed over 190 lives across multiple states.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Megyn Kelly asks why Kamala Harris' husband paraded like 'ideal husband on steroids'
item.description: ​Donald Trump Jr said the allegations against Kamala Harris' husband Doug Emhoff were not covered properly. "Why have I seen exactly ZERO coverage of this story? What happened? Our media is a disgrace. Make sure everyone sees it since the media is clearly running cover for Kamala’s husband," Donald Trump Jr said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sri Lanka's President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announces new cabinet, takes charge of agriculture
item.description: Anura Kumara Dissanayake, now President of Sri Lanka, has assumed control of several key ministries and announced his cabinet appointments. With a focus on eradicating rural poverty and supporting public servants, Dissanayake emphasised unity across all communities. Harini Amarasuriya was appointed as prime minister and will oversee justice, education, and labour.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ryanair Boeing jet with 184 on board catches fire in Italy before take-off
item.description: ​Planes were allowed to fly again at 11.25 am (local time) from Italy's Aeroporti di Puglia airport in Brindisi which saw a temporary suspension of flights after flames were spotted on a Ryanair flight carrying 184 passengers. The Boeing had to abort its take off and was immediately evacuated. Initial reports say the fire was sparked from an issue with the engine, the Sun reported.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nate Silver says Kennedy Jr is a bigger boost than Taylor Swift because...
item.description: In the 2024 election, major endorsements included Taylor Swift and Oprah Winfrey supporting Kamala Harris. However, pollster Nate Silver deemed RFK Jr’s endorsement of Donald Trump more impactful, coinciding with a dip in Harris's poll numbers. While Swift's endorsement drove voter registration, it had minimal influence on voter support, according to an ABC News poll.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Emirates cancels flights to Iraq, Iran and Jordan amid regional unrest
item.description: Due to regional unrest following an Iranian missile strike on Israel, Emirates airline has canceled flights to Iraq, Iran, and Jordan from October 3-5. Lufthansa has also suspended its flights to Beirut, Tel Aviv, and Tehran amid the ongoing tensions. Israeli airstrikes targeted Hezbollah's stronghold in Beirut.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
